name: date-preview
description: Preview date timestamps in a little hover popup with configurable timezones

date-preview.detect.ISO-8601String.markdownDescription: Whether to detect [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format date string.

date-preview.detect.unixTime.description: Whether to detect Unix epoch time. Currently supports 9-10 digits (as seconds) or up to 14 digits (as milliseconds)

date-preview.primaryPreview.name.markdownDescription: Show as the name of primary preview section.

date-preview.primaryPreview.format.markdownDescription: Primary date preview format, described in [day.js format documentation](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format). Leave empty to use ISO-8601 format.

date-preview.primaryPreview.utcOffset.description: UTC offset for the primary preview expressed as a number of hours between -16 and 16 (any number outside of that range will be interpreted as minutes)

date-preview.primaryPreview.timezone.description: Timezone for the primary preview. Timezones are expressed like "PST" or "America/Los_Angeles". This setting will take precedence over Primary Preview: Utc Offset. If both are left blank this will use your local timezone.

date-preview.additionalPreviews.description: Additional previews can be configured in settings.json. Use intellisense to discover possible fields.

name.description: Show as the name of additional preview section.

format.description: Used to format preivew display. Leave empty to use ISO-8601 format.

utcOffset.description: UTC offset expressed as a number of hours between -16 and 16 (any number outside of that range will be interpreted as minutes)

timezone.description: Timezones are expressed like "PST" or "America/Los_Angeles". This setting will take precedence over utcOffset. If both are left blank this will use your local timezone.
